intro: Rondeletia myriantha var. armentalis, commonly known as the silverleaf rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a silvery underside, giving it its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
